Weâ€™re thrilled to announce the appointment of Ekin Caglar as our new Global Chief Technology Officer. As the first key hire since ourâ€¦
data.text:
Thanks to everyone who joined me at Platypus Digital | B Corp's '5 Pillars of Digital Strategy' session yesterday! If you weren't able to make it, here's a snapshop of what you missed: 1. If your vision is why you exist, and your mission is what you're doing to get there, your strategy is how you're going to do it. 2. Digital is a digital marketing and fundraising enabler. It's helping you to do the things you're already doing, but better. So if you're wanting to move in a truly digital-first direction, instead of creating a digital strategy, look to embed digital within your existing ones. 3. Alignment is key. Every goal you set, every tactic you apply, and every decision you make should relate back to your strategy goals and priorities. 4. Just because you build it, doesn't mean they will come. We should all be doing more audience research, and developing asks and products that are specifically tailored to how our supporters experience and move through the world. 5. Strategy is constantly evolving. We don't exist in a vacuum - as the world changes around us, so should our strategies. #strategy #charityfundraising #charitymarketing

5 benefits I see of starting with a one to many approach for #abm ğŸš€ Scalability: Target multiple like-minded accounts simultaneously, expanding reach without stretching resources. ğŸ’¡ Resource Efficiency: Group similar accounts to create resonant campaigns, saving time and costs in development and execution. ğŸ“Š Quick Learning & Optimisation: Faster data and feedback from multiple accounts allow for rapid strategy refinement. ğŸ” Data-Driven Insights: Enhanced analytics capabilities lead to improved targeting and informed decision-making. ğŸ›¡ Risk Mitigation: Diversify efforts across accounts to reduce reliance on individual account success. The 1-to-many ABM approach is a gateway to scalable marketing success, blending personalisation with efficiency. Itâ€™s ideal for those new to ABM like we are at Synthesia , offering us a manageable pathway to experience the benefits without the intensive resources and risks of a 1-to-1 approach. I'd love to hear how you run your ABM! #revenueoperations #Collaboration #marketing

One of the fun parts of being an experienced startup GTM leader is that I get to work with companies that are creating new categories. I've worked with over 40 startups in 17 different industries - Most of the products I've brought to market were simple in concept: replace the status quo manual and inefficient process with a web-based, user-friendly digital tool. Sales have CRMs, Finance, and HR have ERPs, and Product teams have PMS --Marketing still uses Excel for media planning. There's a new category in town, and I am so excited to be a part of it. Most media planning/marketing and advertising teams still use Excel to manage their planning data. In the past 6 months, I've met with heads of Global Media & Marketing at the world's largest retailers and CPG brands. Their teams and agencies still use Excel to manage hundreds of thousands of media marketing data points!! ğŸ˜± McKinsey research confirms the overwhelming majority of consumers expect personalized campaigns that speak to them. This means advertisers often run dozens of campaigns, with different creatives across different channels, for the same product across multiple markets. Many marketers have found this difficult to implement and track, but not for long. Technology is aligning with segmentation. AI is exploding, and with it, marketers have the ability to interact with smarter, fine-tuned precision at speed and scale. The future is more segmentation, not less. More micro marketing, not mass marketing. More varieties of just the right sort. My company, Mediatool.com, provides A Centralized Platform Built For Global Media Teams. Everything that's required to plan and manage global media campaigns in a web-based and easy-to-use platform. This is gonna be fun! ğŸ¤

ğŸš€ Measuring Our Digital Journey: Minyfy's Success Metrics ğŸŒğŸ“Š At Minyfy Digital, we practice what we preach â€“ data-driven decisions and continuous improvement. Today, we're lifting the curtain on our own digital metrics to share our growth story with you: ğŸ“ˆ Traffic Surge: Our website traffic has soared by 150% over the past year, thanks to our strategic SEO efforts and engaging content. ğŸ’¬ Engagement Upswing: We've seen a 200% increase in social media engagement, fostering meaningful discussions and connections with our community. ğŸ”¥ Conversion Champions: Our conversion rates have shot up by 20%, reflecting our commitment to crafting compelling user experiences. ğŸ’¡ Content Impact: Our thought leadership content has reached over 1 million professionals, sparking discussions on industry trends. ğŸŒ Global Reach: With clients spanning 5 continents, we're proud to say we've gone truly global. ğŸ“Š Client Satisfaction: Our Net Promoter Score (NPS) stands at an impressive 75, showcasing the trust our clients place in us. ğŸŒŸ Team Growth: Our Minyfy family has grown by 30%, bringing in fresh talent and diverse perspectives. Behind these metrics are countless hours of dedication, innovative strategies, and the relentless pursuit of digital excellence. We're excited to keep pushing boundaries and delivering outstanding results for our clients and our brand. ğŸ’¬ Let's Chat: What metrics matter most to your brand's digital journey? Share your thoughts in the comments! ğŸ“ˆğŸš€ #DigitalMetrics #SuccessStory #MinyfyDigital #DataDrivenDecisions #DigitalExcellence

If youâ€™ve been looking for free expert advice on launching a retail media network product for scale, youâ€™ve just found it. This webinar covers: â€¢ The four pillars of a successful media product launch â€¢ A step-by-step case studyâ€”from inception to execution (and exceptional results) â€¢ Why most companies settle for franken-tech; and how to avoid that pitfall â€¢ The secret to a 90% faster cycle time â€¢ The one tiny issue that will kill execution â€¢ The reality behind most products: a service under a different name â€¢How to build a sandbox and rules to play by â€¢ The reason most products become a burden/agency instead of a revenue driver â€¢ The necessity of automation, and when to implement it â€¢ Why being â€œscrappyâ€ will destroy your margins â€¢ Which steps to take 1st, 2nd, 3rd, 4th, and how to rinse and repeat (which is the best part) More importantly, none of this is theoretical. Weâ€™ve refined these processes and techniques through several multi-million-dollar media product launches. Click the link to register. Panelists: Veronica Buitron is a 2x co-founder, the CEO of TangoCode, and the Product Manager of Chassis, with decades of experience helping companies in a variety of verticals and industries launch products at scale. Her focus over the past 14 years has been digital marketing. Alex is the principal and founder of Enos Advisors, a consultancy focused on scaling SMBs delivering media, data, and analytical products. In this capacity, Alex draws on more than a decade of experience at agencies and public firms implementing marketing applications for advanced analytics, data science, and disruptive technology. #retailmedianetworks #launchingmediaproducts #scale #scalability #webinar #firstpartydata https://hubs.ly/Q02H8kGQ0

ğŸš€ Big News Alert! ğŸš€ We are thrilled to announce an exciting partnership between The Independent Publishers Alliance and Kogenta for The Independent Marketplace! ğŸ¤ Here at The Independent Marketplace, we're constantly striving to enhance our offerings for advertisers, and this collaboration with Kogenta marks a significant milestone. With Kogenta's advanced technology, we'll now be able to provide our advertising partners with access to rich cookieless data segments like never before. This partnership represents a major leap forward in our mission to empower advertisers with actionable insights as well as continue the battle to support independent journalism via The Independent Marketplace. By leveraging Kogenta's expertise, we're equipping our clients with the tools they need to reach their target audiences more effectively and drive tangible results. Being a new business it was important for us to partner with companies that are prepared for the future of the industry and not relying on legacy technology or strategies. Kogenta's cookieless data gathering and targeting capabilities ensure we are prepared for what's to come. We couldn't be more excited about the possibilities this partnership unlocks, and we're committed to delivering exceptional value to our clients every step of the way. #Independent #Partnership #DataDrivenAdvertising #Innovation #Cookieless #data #curation #Journalism #Premium #Alliance #Marketplace
